result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Micah Farley Nelson-Rowe in court.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Micah Farley Nelson-Rowe.  Prosecuting attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel has discovery and an offer from the State and requests an additional scheduling conference. Court reiterated conditions of bail with the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-06-2022, filed.
Justice Point Violation Report forwarded to Judge for review and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  nk

Defendant Micah Farley Nelson-Rowe in court, appear in person with attorney Theodore OReilly, appear in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer D. Rainey.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-4-2022
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Violation Report 8-3-2022
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for LEVEL 3 SUPERVISION.

Attorney Theodore OReilly in court, defendant Micah Farley Nelson-Rowe not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for return on warrant. Bail hearing proceed.  Arguments heard as to bail. Court sets bail of $1,000.00 Signature Bond.   Court adjourned, Branch 38.  **All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on July 23, 2022.  Original bench warrant scanned.  Case is adjourned until July 27, 2022 at 8:15 AM for Return on Bench Warrant in Branch 38, Rm 502 SB.  Notice is given to Public Defenders Office and District Attorney.
filed.

COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Tedia K. Gamino in court.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. The defendant having failed to appear, the court ordered a bench warrant to issue, any bond forfeited and Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification by the Clerk of Circuit Court.
Tedia Gamino; filed.
Tedia Gamino; filed.

Defendant Micah Farley Nelson-Rowe in court in person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  all Menards locations.
filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Micah Farley Nelson-Rowe in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Micah Farley Nelson-Rowe in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
